sect1.title: FlyMine status
sect1.para: The FlyMine database is currently in the late stages of Beta release. We believe that it contains an accurate representation of the source databases, but for some sources we are still working to complete the integration and add value.

We are planning to extend the FlyMine web site to include viewing and analysis tools, including genome annotation brower (perhaps GBrowse), microarray analysis tools and a 3D structure viewer (such as Java Mage).

sect2.title: Current Data Sources
sect2.para: FlyMine has the following datasource available:

itemizedlist.listitem: Genome Annotation for D. melanogaster and A. gambiae from Ensembl
Orthologues between D. melanogaster and A. gambiae from Ensembl
Orthologues and Paralogues between D. melanogaster and C. elegans from inParanoid
2-hybrid protein-protein interactions for D. melanogaster: Curagen set (Giot et al (2003) Science 302 1727-1736) and Hybrigenics set
2-hybrid protein-protein interactions for C. elegans: (Li et al (2004) Science 303 540-543)
RNAi phenotypes for C. elegans from WormBase

sect2.title: Planned Datasources
sect2.para: We are in process of adding the following datasources:

itemizedlist.listitem: 3-D structural predictions for protein domains from Dr Kenji MIZUGUCHI.
Go annotation (from the Gene Ontology Consortium) together with orthologue/paralogue predictions for several model organisms (from inParanoid).
